body.name: Metal Storage Cabinet, 71”H Locking Storage Cabinet with Adjustable Shelves, Steel Storage Cabinets for Garage, Home Office, Pantry (White)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 12 hrs 22 mins.
features: LOCKABLE STORAGE CABINET - Locking storage cabinet with 2 keys prevent unauthorized access to protect your private items secure, and keeping children and pets away from harmful and unsafe products.

HIGH-QUALITY: High-quality steel materials and powder coating make the storage cabinet durable, stable and easy to clean. The pre-holes on the back plate help to installed on the wall and prevent tilting.

ADJUSTABLE SHELFS - Four shelves in the metal cabinet can be adjusted freely to provide adaptability and convenience. And each shelf of the metal storage cabinets can loading capacity of 180 pounds, there is plenty of safe space to organize tools, household items, office supplies, books, file, food, toys etc.

MULTIPURPOSE - Metal storage cabinet with doors and shelves provide large and safe space. Magnet design keep the cabinet closed and mute pad could avoid noise. Metal cabinet with lock is a good choice for the garage, office, laundry room, home, kitchen pantry, utility room, workshop, school , basement, living room and so much more.
EASY TO ASSEMBLE - The white storage cabinet comes unassembled, and we provide very detailed installation instructions in the package. Dimensions inches: 70.86" H x 31.5" W x 15.75" D.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great storage for the garage
reviews.reviewText: First off let me say how easy this was to assemble. Do not let it scare you. This is my second one to buy. Light weight but sturdy

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice and sturdy and easy to assemble.
reviews.reviewText: I'm not sure what is wrong with the people who said this was difficult to assemble. It was very easy. I've assembled a lot of furniture in my days and this is one of the easier pieces, probably because it's all metal you don't have those dowels and other screw in attachments like you do with wood furniture.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great multi-use for storage. Easy to assemble.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice cabinet, some not-too-huge issues
reviews.reviewText: This was easier to assemble than some of the others have said (one saying "5 hours", which mine was nothing like that), but not "super easy" as some have reported. For me, it was somewhere in between.First, the condition of the box contents ... the box arrived in good shape, no apparent abuse, no dents or rips or whatever. The box tells you not to worry if it's beaten up because the contents will be OK. Well, I will believe that the contents would survive a lot of abuse in transit, but it won't help if the stuff is already damaged before it's ever packaged, which is what I believe has happened. The contents are in a thick corrugate box with 3 standard packing straps, and inside all of the flat panels are arranged efficiently and sandwiched between two 1/8" thick sturdy dense particle board sheets, which will be enough to protect it. Around all of the edges are some good solid metal L-shaped edge protectors that will take the abuse instead of the cabinet components. These things were a great idea, though I guess I'll see if I can take them to the local recycling yard to put into the scrap metal bin so they aren't wasted because that's a lot of extra metal.The panels on the outsides were undamaged. It was just two of the panels sandwiched between others that had large dents on the edges (not on the big surfaces), which HAD to have already taken place before packaging because there was no damage between that and the outside of the box and no way anything inside could have made such a large dent. One of these was the left cabinet side along the top, right where it actually created a serious problem for attaching the top front cross bar because the dent was pushing into the area where the parts of the cross bar have to be. It took me a good long time with a couple of sets of pliers to carefully shape this back to where it could be assembled. The other dent was the edge of one of the shelves, and that wasn't impacting the ability to assemble, and was easier to shape back to normal with the pliers. That edge went to the back so that the imperfections caused by correcting the dent aren't visible. The miscut hole is just a manufacturing defect that seems too common with assemble-it-yourself furniture and fixtures. The dented pieces that had to have happened before packaging is really not excusable though. Quality control and handling at the manufacturer's facility is obviously not good enough, and I see that some others have complained of damaged parts.Aside from this there was one defect where a screw hole should be accessible behind another piece of metal on the same panel (two metal sheets on the panel, the top one with a cutout and a screwhole in the 2nd supposedly right behind the cutout) -- the cutout wasn't lining with the screwhole so I had to use a punch and hammer to make it work, which it did in the end. What if someone didn't have all of these extra tools that I have?As for assembly, I had to consult a video that someone linked on this product page which shows two men assembling this cabinet. One part was *NOT* (!!!!) explained correctly in the instructions and the video cleared that issue right up. First, the instructions are just stupid on the first part of the assembly, It has you assembling it upright, which is damned hard to get things lined up while it's standing. Laying the parts down as if it's being assembled with its back to the ground makes a lot more sense and makes lining everything up easier. It does have you lay it down around whichever step has you dealing with the top panel. Just assemble it entirely laying down even before this and it goes much easier.In fact, for step 6 it has you putting the bottom crossbar in, but not the screws, then putting the bottom panel on that crossbar and THEN putting 4 screws in. Problem is, now with the bottom panel on, you can only get at 2 of the 4 screws and it doesn't tell you how to get to the other 2. It asks you to put the 4 in and then later you're laying the unit down on its back. The men in the video assembled it on its back all along, and that was where you can see that when it's laying down, those other 2 screw holes are accessible from underneath the cabinet. So bad (!!) BAD instructions!! Anyway, other than these issues with the instructions, the only thing that was a constant annoyance was in trying to get a normal sized screwdriver with a normal handle to lay flat enough in places to install various screws, because the holes are right next to a panel and so close to it that your screwdriver is almost certainly at a slight angle so that it's trying to drive the screw into the hole at an angle as well. This takes some finessing to get it to go in straight.That's it with the issues, though. It didn't take a second person. I'm not Superman, but it wasn't hard at all to lift it back upright when needed and it wasn't the worst project for needing 3 or 4 hands. Virtually all of it was possible to line things up and attach a screw with just your two hands. I did assemble it myself.In the end, it's also pretty sturdy, and for the $200 it's fine. You're not going to get a thick-walled industrial-grade cabinet with the high quality locking mechanism for $200. This is about as good as it gets for that much, and it's just what I needed for keeping some office supplies better organized.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Putting it together is supposed to be a two-person job. I had no help, so it took a few hours to do it. But is a strong, well-made cabinet. I've ordered two more.

reviews.reviewText: Good quality and easy to assemble cabinet. It came really quick plus they answer all my questions in a timely manner.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Took forever to install, bolts were too big to attach to the holes, flimsy, and dents too easily, it took forever to install. Do not recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Too much assembly time!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.reviewText: I ordered file cabinet mainly the price, it took FOREVER to unpack, it was very well packed and insulated againts damage I thought BUT one panel was dented in two places. Fortunately it was in places that would really not be seen, I wish there was an option for the doors to be black instead of grey, but for the price I paid I was willing to settle. And my office is purple (with hint of black/grey).Putting it together was hard also, guess because I did it by myself my nuggets kept barking at it, it took up there favorite place 😊 I hope its sturdy because while putting it together it didn’t feel that strong.Seriouly shouldn’t take this most time putting it together and the plastic clip should been black or grey instead of white but hopefully once I put items inside they wont be seen. This is the main reason I gave the rate I did. I need another and I wont be getting the same one I’ll go some where else.
